intro: Arthrostylidium fimbriatum, commonly known as the fringe-leaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Australia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring narrow, grass-like leaves and showy yellow flowers with white margins. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in coastal and sandy habitats. Its botanical features include a basal rosette of leaves and inflorescences that resemble daisies, making it a distinctive and ornamental species.
